name: Rajmachi Fort (Shrivardhan & Manaranjan)
duration: 4-5 hours (one way from Karjat/condensed routes); 8-10 hours (full round trip including fort summits)
elevation: Shrivardhan Fort: 930 m; Manaranjan Fort: 820 m
description: Rajmachi trek features two historic Sahyadri hill forts, Shrivardhan and Manaranjan, perched amidst lush valleys between Lonavala and Karjat. Famous for fireflies (pre-monsoon), monsoon waterfalls, and sweeping Deccan views, the trek offers camping or homestays in Udhewadi village. Trek routes are beginner-friendly but can be long and muddy in rainy months. Stunning stargazing and a vibrant local hospitality experience await at the twin-fort summit.

startingPoint.name: Udhewadi Village (Base for both approaches)
facilities: Local villagers offer tent rental and home stays
startingPoint.description: Udhewadi, the base village, is accessible from Lonavala (via Tungarli Dam, 16 km off-road) and from Karjat/Kondiwade (via Kondhane caves route, 6-7 km trek). Only SUVs/bikes recommended in peak monsoon. Camping site and homestays are run by local families.

restaurants: Pre-ordered home meals from Udhewadi villagers (veg/non-veg thali, poha, tea)
shops: Small provision shops (packaged snacks/water bottles; limited stock)
waterSources: Well/bore water in village (safe to drink post-boiling/filtering)
Natural streams in monsoon (treat before drinking)
Carry 2–3L per person especially in summer/post-monsoon
foodOptions: No stalls en route—carry packed lunch

facilities: No food/water supply at forts; carry all essentials from village

locations: Private camp sites (arranged by locals or trek companies)
facilities: Porch/hall stay (with villagers, by advance booking)
Basic mats and blankets (bring own if possible)
camping.cost: ₹300–600 per person (camping spot/tent); ₹500–900 per person incl. meals

nearbyStays.name: Rajmachi Heaven Udhewadi (Homestay)
nearbyStays.cost: ₹550–900 per person incl. food (check for latest)

permits.entry: Entry by Rs. 5/trekker (for trail maintenance); parking Rs. 100 (car), Rs. 20 (bike) collected by village committee at Udhewadi
permits.timings: Open sunrise–sunset; night camping/trek allowed, inform village chief if staying

safety.riskLevel: Low to Moderate (easy terrain, long approach in monsoon)
precautions: Start early in day—long approach in monsoon

monsoon.conditions: Heavy rain, waterfalls, frequent fog and leeches, slippery approach
monsoon.recommendation: Best for fireflies/waterfalls, bring rain gear/extra socks

summer.conditions: Hot afternoons, dry trails, less crowded
summer.recommendation: Early start advised; carry extra water

trekRoute.totalDistance: 16–18 km (one-way from Lonavala, Jeep/cab to Fanasari possible); 6–7 km from Karjat (Kondiwade)
trekRoute.ascent: Approx. 600 m (full ascent from both approaches)
trekRoute.difficulty: Easy (Karjat approach, short and steep); Moderate (Lonavala, long but gentle, off-road longest in rains)

waypoints.name: Lonavala: Tungarli Dam/Fanasari
waypoints.description: Jeep ride to off-road trailhead, walk starts here in monsoon

waypoints.name: Karjat: Kondiwade/Kondhane
waypoints.description: Karjat to Kondiwade (auto/jeep); trek via Kondana caves

waypoints.name: Manaranjan Fort
waypoints.description: Fort summit, panoramic views, moderate climb

byTrain.description: Local train to Lonavala, then jeep/auto to Fanasari, then 7 km trek to Udhewadi
steps: Train from Mumbai CST/Dadar to Lonavala
Auto/jeep (in season, shared) to Fanasari (16 km off-road)
Trek from Fanasari to Udhewadi (6–7 km)

byBus.description: Bus to Lonavala, then jeep/auto to Fanasari, then 7 km trek

byPrivateVehicle.description: Drive via Mumbai-Pune Expressway to Lonavala, then off-road to Udhewadi (SUVs/bikes only in monsoon)
steps: Follow Della Resorts road towards Rajmachi (16 km off-road)

byTrain.description: Train to Lonavala, then as above

byBus.description: Bus to Lonavala, then as above
steps: Bus to Lonavala, jeep to Fanasari/Udhewadi, walk
Pune–Lonavala route, then follow private vehicle instructions above

bestTimeToVisit: May–June (fireflies season), June–September (monsoon/waterfalls), November–February (clear, winter camping)

localContacts.name: GoNeeDa Wadi Udhewadi
localContacts.service: Homestay, tent rental, guide, food, safe cycling/camping

localContacts.name: Udhewadi Local Home Kitchen
localContacts.service: Food pre-order (basic thali/tea/poha), guide on request
